p: Concerning the bark essential oil, qualitative and quantitative differences emerged in comparison to the young stems profile. A relevant percentage of 1,8-cineole ( 13) (68.6%) was detected to be even higher than that of DL-EO. The other main compounds were terpinen-4-ol ( 21) (6.2%) and α-terpineol ( 22) (6.1%). The bark essential oil was also characterized by the occurrence of exclusive sesquiterpenes such as ( E)-caryophyllene ( 29), α-humulene ( 30), spathulenol ( 38), humulene epoxide ( 40) and epi- α-cadinol ( 41), all occurring in relative amounts lower than or equal to 0.3%, except for α-humulene reaching 1.1%.
